name: Raymond Loewy
biography: Prolific industrial designer.  Known for his designs for the 1947 Studebaker Starlight Coupe, S-1 Steam locomotive for the Pennsylvania Railroad, the Coca Cola bottle, Lucky Strike, Greyhound Bus, Pennsylvania S-1 Locomotive, Exxon and Shell logos, etc.  Co-founder of Raymond Loewy Associates (renamed Loewy/Snaith in 1961).  Founder of CEI (Compagnie d'Esthetique Industrielle) in 1952.  Active in the United States from 1919.
